wer.hyp: People look, but no one ever finds it. When a man looks for something beyond his reach, his friends say he's looking for a pot of gold at the end of the rainbow. Throughout the centuries, people have explained the rainbow in various ways.

wer.hyp: We believe that if no one has a gun yet, when a man looks for something beyond his reach, when his friend's safe, when he's looking for a pot of coffee, when he's in a hurry, when he's on the run, to help the sentry, he's going to have to find a light in the ground. Who wants a dead soldier?
wer.ref: It might happen again, he added with an involuntary smile. It is sold, sir, was in the laconic reply. And you must have some water, my dear fellow. What is that flying about? Who wants a dead soul?
